item.description:
Join our own Frank Heller of Katahdin Energy Works who will be giving us a survey of some home and residential scale alternative energy options that we have not yet spent much time discussing. Biogas Digesters, small-scale wind and microhydro, village-scale water wheels, etc. Frank will give us some pros and cons of each as well as some budget numbers on what we can expect to spend on these options. He will also point us in the direction of some do-it-yourself plans!

Potluck at 6:30
Discussion starts around 7:15
Wrap up Q&A by 8:30 or 8:45


Please see our Meetup Event RSVP Guidelines:
http://permaculture.m...

Please remember to bring your own potluck kit (plate/bowl/utensils/cup/napkin)! Please consider bringing your digital camera and posting up a few photos after the event!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: November Meetup - More Home & Neighborhood Scale Energy Options
